intro: Craspedia adenophora, commonly known as the coastal flax or silver flax, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, silver-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along coastal cliffs. Craspedia adenophora is well adapted to salty and windy environments, making it a hardy plant in coastal ecosystems.
